Self confidence always comes in time! One day you will realise that no one takes notice.
About a year ago when my anxiety was much much worse than it is now, I went to stay with my Aunty and I told her i physically couldnâ€™t go to coles with her so I had to stay home and she told me this â€œnot everythingâ€™s about you. I understand youâ€™re self conscious and have anxiety going to public places but no ones going to be looking at you and secretly judging anything about your appearance. Theyâ€™re not even looking at you and if they are for all you know they could be thinking youâ€™re gorgeous. No one cares about your outer appearance. No one is perfect so get up because youâ€™re coming to the shops with meâ€ 
And since then that has just stuck with me. I do not walk past anyone and think anything negatively about their appearance. Weâ€™re all beautiful in our own way but that doesnâ€™t even really matter, everything is on the inside and if you arenâ€™t a beautiful person on the inside, your outer looks really do not matter or phase me at all. 
Iâ€™m sure youâ€™re a beautifully souled person and that really would show on your outer! I hope you find your way to being more confident than you are and Iâ€™m sorry youâ€™re struggling with your appearance.
Weâ€™ve all been there and itâ€™s a tough road to becoming truly content with who you are and what you look like but honestly, every person on this earth has their insecurities and most of the time I think weâ€™re all too busy focusing on our own insecurities rather than trying to pick out something wrong with another person. The right people love you for who you are as a person and not what physical characteristics  you do or donâ€™t possess! I think you should ask yourself also would you rather be with someone who thinks youâ€™re naturally an amazing person, looks wise and personality wise. Or would you rather someone only be with you because they think youâ€™re good looking? I know Id definitely prefer someone to be with me for who I am as a person and not because they think Iâ€™m attractive. I hope things look up for you soon and that you realise youâ€™re amazing just the way you are!

I really donâ€™t know what advice I can give. Iâ€™m so sorry for what you went through and that youâ€™re struggling right now. 
Itâ€™s not the same at all but sometimes when Iâ€™m so deeply depressed and overwhelmed by all of the feelings I have I feel dead and then I scare myself by thinking â€œwait, am I actually aliveâ€ it doesnâ€™t last for long but I look around and have to touch everything and I end up coming back down to earth and realising I am alive. 
Anyways, honestly just pinch yourself. Say to yourself I am alive, this world is real and what you had to go through was a massive thing and that you no longer need your defence mechanism. 
If a psychologist is accessible and affordable for you I would recommend seeing a professional as they can help you with so many strategies to continue this life without any defence mechanisms at all and to also help pull yourself out of that â€œnothing is realâ€ mindset. 
If you are unable to see a psychologist I am always here if you need a chat! Even if youâ€™d like to give me a message now Iâ€™m more than willing to listen to you speak in more detail about everything if you like. 

This is just a reminder also that everything is real and that you are actually living, breathing and alive in this very moment. Your life clearly has not been easy and has had a lot of downfalls and mistreatments but now you need to try and get back to 100% and to a really happy place within yourself. Do just one good thing today to try and feel alive. Put on your favourite song so loudly and dance around and just scream â€œIâ€™m aliveâ€. That might sound a bit silly but I think that it would be worth a try. Good luck with everything and I truly hope you see the other side of this!!
